issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
I am using Titanium 3.2 which has many modules etc that supersede previous versions and deprecate them.  When I look at the modules in the Marketplace I don't see any way to search for 3.2x unless there are none?  Currently the options look like this on the left hand side for all categories with no additional filters:

Minimum Titanium Version
Titanium 1.6
Titanium 1.7
Titanium 1.8
Titanium 2.0
Titanium 1.5
Titanium 2.1
Titanium 3.0
Titanium 3.0.2
Titanium 3.1
Titanium 3.1.2

comments.body: Titanium 3.2 and 3.2.1 are available in the "Minimum Titanium Version" category. Note that it represents the minimum Titanium SDK version required for a module so most of the modules that automatically work with 3.2 release would not show up with this filter as they work with previous versions as well.
